intro: Tecoma amazonica, commonly known as the yellow bells, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Tecoma amazonica thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in warm climates.
